RautSoft.econometrics.general
Class MaximumLikelihood

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.econometrics.general.MaximumLikelihood

public class MaximumLikelihood
extends java.lang.Object

Maximum Likelihood Estimation of a linear model on a XYDatasetpassed in the constructor of a MaximumLikelihood object.

Example of use: 

        final int k = 2, n=500;

        final double [][] dataArray =new double[n][k+1];

        for (int i=0;i<n;i++){
            data[i][0]= 100*Math.random();
            for (int j=0;j<k;j++){
                data[i][j+1]=10*(j+1)*Math.random();
                data[i][0] += 2*Math.sqrt(j+1)*data[i][j+1];
            }
        }

        Dataset dat= new Dataset(dataArray);
        String[] vLabel = {"Artificial", "X1 (random)","X2 (random)"};
        String[] vName = {"y", "X1","X2"};
        dat.setVLabel(vLabel);
        dat.setVName(vName);

        MaximumLikelihood mle= new MaximumLikelihood(new XYDataset(dat));
        mle.Compute();
        System.out.println("MLE output:\n" +mle.getOutput() );

Author:
Lakshmi Raut
